After the drive connection there may be a short wait time required for proper operation
Please specify the timeout (in seconds) for trying to ejecting the device

Some drives are not automatically spinning down when idle. If a 'hdparm -S x ' command should be send to the device before unmounting to set it to sleep after a delay, enter here a value here. Allowed: x=0 ... 255.
x=1...240: x * 5 seconds, e.g. x=5: 25s, x=120: 10min,
x= 241...251: (x-240) * 30 min, e.g. 243 = 90min, 246=3h
The size of the log files is automatically limitted. If the given line count is reached, the elder half is removed.
Several debug log file message detail levels are available: 1 ... 8. The higher the value the more details.
The package generates DSM desktop messages, which are shown on the desktop to a configurable user group or to a user. Prepend an @ to group names, e.g. @users for all users

Use of 'Copy LED':
0: LED is not used at all.
1: Turn ON at drive attachment, OFF at eject
2: Start flashing at drive attachment, OFF at eject
3: Turn ON at attachment, OFF at a sucessfully eject, flashing if ejection failed
Beeper use by the script: Short beep at insert and eject, tripple long beep for an error

Third party packages are restricted by Synology in DSM 7.x! Since UsbEject does require root permission to perform its job an additional manual step is required after the installation.

Open a SSH command shell to your NAS (as an admin user) and execute the following command after the installation is finished.
Instead of via a SSH command window you can execute this command via a userdefined script (as user 'root'), generated via control panel, scheduled task. And run that after the finished installation.
You may copy the command now!
